data.title: Going to the American Museum of Natural…
data.meta_description: Located on the west side of Central Park between 77th and 81st Streets, the American Museum of Natural History is one of the world’s most esteemed…
data.text:
Home to numerous exhibitions and historical collections showcasing everything from dinosaurs to space exploration, the American Museum of Natural History is a beloved spot among science and history enthusiasts. Explore permanent exhibitions featuring a wide array of fossil collections, dioramas, life-size statues, and galleries, along with special exhibits throughout the year. For those interested in visiting, the American Museum of Natural History is located at 200 Central Park West, easily accessible to Central Park.

The museum’s close proximity to the Park makes it a convenient destination for locals and tourists alike to continue their journey through the natural world. Enter Central Park through Naturalists’ Gate on 77th Street and Central Park West, directly across from the museum, to explore Naturalists’ Walk, a quiet wooded area. Continue into Central Park to see Strawberry Fields, Shakespeare Garden, Belvedere Castle, Bethesda Terrace, and the Ramble.

Whether you’re planning a brief visit or an extended exploration, knowing the American Museum of Natural History hours and its exact location at 200 Central Park West will help create the perfect day in New York City.
